solution.text:
given that st || qr
\(\Rightarrow \angle pst = \angle pqr\) and \(\angle pts= \angle prt\)(corresponding angles)
Now in \(\bigtriangleup \) pst and \(\bigtriangleup \)pqr , we have
\(\angle pst = \angle pqr\) and \(\angle pts= \angle prt\)
Therefore by AA criteria,\(\bigtriangleup \) pst ~ \(\bigtriangleup \)pqr
\(\Rightarrow \frac {area(pst)}{area(pqr)}= [\frac {pt}{pr}]^2\)
now we can see, area(pqr)=area(pst)+area(qrts)
it can also be written as area(pqr)=\(4\times \)area(pst) as \(3 \times \)area(pst)=area(qrts) [given]
\(\Rightarrow \frac {area(pst)}{area(pqr)}=\frac 14= [\frac {pt}{pr}]^2\)
taking square root on both sides we get\(\frac 1{\sqrt 4}=\frac {pt}{pr}=\frac 12\)
\(\Rightarrow pr=2\times pt\Rightarrow pt+tr=2\times pt\)
\(\Rightarrow pt=tr=_{j}_\)

content.text:
In the given figure st || qr and the area of quadrilateral (qrts) is three times area of \(\bigtriangleup \)pst.
If tr=_{j}_cm, find the length of pt.
